title: MPlayer.Portable.Stealth.Multilanguage.WinAll (VLC Alternative)
description:
MPlayer.Portable.Stealth.Multilanguage.WinAll (VLC Alternative)

Website: http://www.mplayer-ww.com/eng/
Version: R33064.
Stealth [?]: Yes.
Writes to: Application Folder (USB/Portable Media Ready).
Dependencies: Admin. Rights (CD/DVD Drive Use).
Limitations: None.
License: Freeware.
Language: English, Chinese, Japanese, Korean.
Compatible: WinAll, 32/64.
How to Use: Copy to desired folder and use.

What's different between this and the portable version on MPlayer's website?
MPlayer's official portable version is NOT stealth; it leaves trash behind. If
you don't mind this, then by all means, use that.

Why do you provide 2 version?
1. MPlayer is the 'Lite' version. Maybe you can use this for your USB device?
2. MPlayer-(F) is the 'Lite' version plus all available codecs & tools. Maybe
this can be used at your home PC? This will play anything you throw at it, even
DVD, CD, and BluRays!
